item.title: Report E-2024020535
item.description:
Report E-2024020535

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: SAUK VILLAGE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 22, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1755 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the released product and swept them in with hand tools. The other tote on the shipment was wiped down with a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads. All spent absorbents, PPE, and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums that were labeled appropriately and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • City: LA GRANGE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND BY THE HAZMAT CAGE WRAPPED IN MULTIPLE LAYERS OF PLASTIC BAGS AND PLACED IN A HAZMAT BIN DescribePack: 1 BOTTLE HAD A MISSING SEAL FROM THE MANUFACTURER AS WELL AS A SMALL HOLE IN THE CAP WHICH LOOKS TO BE A MANUFACTURER DEFECT, AS IT IS IN ALL 4 CAPS AND IS PERFECTLY ROUND. THIS LED TO THE PRODUCT LEAKING ONTO THE BOX, WHICH THEN WAS TORN DUE TO BEING WET. DurationRel: 49 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS WRAPPED IN MULTIPLE LAYERS OF PLASTIC BAGS AND PLACED IN A HAZMAT BIN

item.title: Report E-2024020514
item.description:
Report E-2024020514

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: MELROSE PARK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 13, 2024, one (1) 15-gallon drum of UN1760 was punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1760-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged container of product was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024020483
item.description:
Report E-2024020483

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSW experienced a UN3265 Dequest 2000 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor and a 20’ x 8’ area of the concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed to neutralize and clean the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged drum of material was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL AND BRING IT BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
